course_title: Data Management Protection, Cyber Security, Privacy
class_notes:
JM  Students only.  Per ABA rules, JD and LLM students will NOT receive credit for JM courses
This course is offered ONLINE
"This course provides an in-depth look at cybersecurity and privacy laws and regulations, data
management and data breach response after creating a sound background in the technology that underpins these topics. Topics will include computer networking and security, identity theft and identity protection laws, industryspecific cybersecurity regulations, IoT privacy regulations and standards, data breach response, and planning to secure and manage data."
course_description: Managing data, and protecting the privacy of individuals, companies, and governments, is a key element of any modern business practice. In this course, students will study the legal requirements of businesses and entities to protect and manage data, current and emerging standards of information privacy, and the legal impact of cybersecurity breaches and attacks. Particular focus will be placed on sensitive systems, including health care systems.
